subject: Re: Nesa Interactive Wheel
preview: Hi Heath,  The error looks to be gone now. Thanks for looking into this for me.   Kind regards,  Jamie Shek Director, Maker's Mark Creative    // M 0423 592 912 // E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au //

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

The error looks to be gone now. Thanks for looking into this for me.


Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker's Mark Creative



// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au
// A Level 1, 616 Balcombe Road, Black Rock, 3193 VIC


The material contained in this email may be confidential, and may also be the subject of copyright and/or privileged information. If you are not the intended recipient, please delete it. Internet communications are not secure and accordingly Maker's Mark Creative does not accept any legal liability for the contents or damage caused by this message.

Hi Jamie, 

Joel managed to isolate the problem down to some residual code left over from W3 Total Cache. We added a line of code to the .htaccess file that clears the errors out. 

Please refresh and let me know how it goes?

@joel Can you please investigate this one and get back to Jamie, or if all good, close out the ticket. 

Thanks!

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

Thanks! Yes, seems to be loading
much better now.

I’m running through your recommendations now too.

One thing, are you able to look at this consol error?



Kind regards,

Jamie Shek
Director, Maker’s Mark Creative

// M 0423 592 912
// E jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au <mailto:jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au>
// A Level 1, 616 Balcombe Road, Black Rock, 3193 VIC

The material contained in this email may be confidential, and may also be the subject of copyright and/or privileged information. If you are not the intended recipient, please delete it. Internet communications are not secure and accordingly Maker’s Mark Creative does not accept any legal liability for the contents or damage caused by this message.

> On 30 Nov 2018, at 10:09, Heath Maguire <heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>> wrote:
>
> Hi Jamie,
>
> I had chat to Joel as discussed.
>
> By hiding the iframe with CSS only, it would still load the resources (depending on when the CSS instruction kicks in).
>
> So Joel has made some tweaks with JavaScript.
>
> He has instructed the WP page to be fully rendered first —> then do a check for browser size, it more than 768px —> then instruct to load the iframe. Essentially a defer load. This has reduced the page load time from the mid to high 20’s down to the 2second range, see attached. (the same as the other pages without the diagram).
>
> If you do the other tweaks I mentioned, I think you should be able to shave another second off. If you want further gains, it will require a server move and ideally server side caching.
>
> The tweaks:
>
> - WP Rocket
> - Imagify
> - Remove ShortPixel CDN from Autooptimize
> - Turn off any unused plugins (and delete them for security)
> - You can still keep Autooptimize running as well
>
> That should do the trick… have a play with it now and see how it feels?
>
> Cheers,
>
> Heath Maguire
> heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>
>
>
>
>> On 30 Nov 2018, at 12:08 am, Jamie Shek <jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au <mailto:jamie@makersmarkcreative.com.au>> wrote:
>>
>> Hi Heath,
>>
>> As you know, we got the Interactive wheel installed. We’re facing a few issues however, generally the site is very slow. I know each page is loaded full of rich content so that was to be expected.
>>
>> The about page (which has the interactive wheel) is particularly slow and sometimes even fails to load. It’s worse on mobile.
>>
>> When running it through google page insights tester, it errors out - https://developers.google.com/speed/pagespeed/insights/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fannualreport2018.nesa.com.au%2Fabout%2F <https://developers.google.com/speed/pagespeed/insights/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fannualreport2018.nesa.com.au%2Fabout%2F>
>>
>> There’s some page errors showing up in the console. I’m not sure if they are related to the wheel... Are you able to have a look and fix up the errors?
>>
>> Also, if you have any thoughts on speeding up the site that would be greatly appreciated. I’ve got Autoptimse and W3 Total cache running.
>>
>> Kind regards,
>>
>> Jamie Shek
>> Director, Maker’s Mark Creative
>>

>>>>>>>>> On 22 Nov 2018, at 10:22, Heath Maguire <heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>> wrote:
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Hi Jamie,
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> We have been pondering this one. There are 2 options from what we have experienced.
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Option 1 - Quick, cheap, but a little clunky
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Would be to use something like this with image ‘hot spots’, clickable areas that reveal more content. E.g. https://drnirmalpatel.com/ <https://drnirmalpatel.com/> scroll down to the sketch of the inner ear. (there are plugins we can recommend or it can be hardcoded).
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Option 2 - SVG, smooth, nice, but quite involved
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> The graphic would need to be created in Illustrator and exported as an SVG. We would then use JavaScript to target the sections/rings to load the content on hover/or click.
>>>>>>>>> Something like that would take 2- 3 days at best to get web ready we estimate.
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Let me know your thoughts? Cheers
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Heath Maguire
>>>>>>>>> Director
